article_title: HHS Rule Provides Broad Anti-Discrimination Protections
article_text:
HHS Rule Provides Broad Anti-Discrimination Protections

Law360, New York (September 9, 2015, 1:22 PM ET) -- On Sept. 8, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services' Office of Civil Rights published a sweeping proposed rule implementing Section 1557 of the Affordable Care Act. The rule provides that individuals cannot be subject to discrimination based on their race, color, national origin, sex, age or disability in certain health programs and activities.



The proposed rule reaffirms requirements provided by existing federal civil rights laws and attempts to clarify the standards HHS would apply in implementing Section 1557 of the ACA. The proposed rule...

article_metadata.description: The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services' recently published rule implementing Section 1557 of the Affordable Care Act broadly prohibits discrimination on the basis of sex in health programs, and includes significant requirements related to transgender individuals and the treatment of gender dysphoria, say Lisa Campbell and Tamara Killion of Groom Law Group.
